a.title: Legend for this format

description.value: Availability Type: Availability data for an {item}.

short.value: Availability data for an {item}

definition.value: Availability data for an {item}.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

short.value: Unique id for inter-element referencing

definition.value: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

description.value: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

short.value: Additional content defined by implementations

definition.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comment.value: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

short.value: Times the {item} is available

definition.value: Times the {item} is available.

requirements.value: A collection of times that the {item} is available.

human.value: Cannot include start/end times when selecting all day availability.

expression.value: allDay.exists().not() or (allDay implies availableStartTime.exists().not() and availableEndTime.exists().not())

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

short.value: Unique id for inter-element referencing

definition.value: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

description.value: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

short.value: Additional content defined by implementations

definition.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comment.value: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

short.value: mon | tue | wed | thu | fri | sat | sun

definition.value: mon | tue | wed | thu | fri | sat | sun.

requirements.value: Indicates which days of the week are available between the start and end Times.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

valueString.value: The purpose for which an extended contact detail should be used.

short.value: Always available? i.e. 24 hour service

definition.value: Always available? i.e. 24 hour service.

requirements.value: Is this always available? (hence times are irrelevant) i.e. 24 hour service.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

short.value: Opening time of day (ignored if allDay = true)

definition.value: Opening time of day (ignored if allDay = true).

comment.value: The time zone is expected to be specified or implied by the context this datatype is used.

requirements.value: The opening time of day. Note: If the AllDay flag is set, then this time is ignored.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

short.value: Closing time of day (ignored if allDay = true)

definition.value: Closing time of day (ignored if allDay = true).

comment.value: The time zone is expected to be specified or implied by the context this datatype is used.

requirements.value: The closing time of day. Note: If the AllDay flag is set, then this time is ignored.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

short.value: Not available during this time due to provided reason

definition.value: Not available during this time due to provided reason.

requirements.value: The {item} is not available during this period of time due to the provided reason.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

short.value: Unique id for inter-element referencing

definition.value: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

description.value: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

short.value: Additional content defined by implementations

definition.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comment.value: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

short.value: Reason presented to the user explaining why time not available

definition.value: Reason presented to the user explaining why time not available.

comment.value:
The reason will generally be provided to give the textual reason for displaying when the {item} is not available, e.g. 'Closed public holidays' or 'Independence Day'. In cases such as this, the `during` might not be included and local knowledge would be required in such cases (as don't desire to keep updating when the holiday occurs each year).
e.g.2: 'Closed for maintenance over the summer' for this example you would want to include the `during` period, unless this was a university hospital and the "summer" period was well known, but would recommend its inclusion anyway.

requirements.value: The reason that can be presented to the user as to why this time is not available.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

short.value: Service not available during this period

definition.value: Service not available during this period.

requirements.value: The {item} is not available (seasonally or for a public holiday) during this period.
